title.narrative: SKILLS DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By 2025, the education system and other stakeholders have increased capacity to equip the most vulnerable adolescent girls and boys, including those out-of-school and at risk of drop-out, those engaged in child labour, and children in or at risk of child marriage, with relevant learning, including life skills., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, the most vulnerable and at-risk adolescents and young people are learning, acquiring relevant skills, and participating meaningfully in an environment that is safe and responsive to the needs of both girls and boys.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, the education system and other stakeholders have increased capacity to equip the most vulnerable adolescent girls andboys, including those out-of-school and at risk of drop-out, those engaged in child labour, and children in or at risk of childmarriage, with relevant learning, including life skills.

description.narrative: Working with MoNE, community-based organizations and municipalities, UNICEF continued to support skills development among adolescents for their empowerment,;civic engagement, prevention of gender-based violence, including child marriage, and;school-to-work transition. Vulnerable refugees were identified and enrolled in non-formal and/or informal education opportunities to reintegrate back into the formal education system. UNICEF supported social cohesion in school and community settings with awareness-raising on social tensions, cyber and anti-bullying amongst children, parents, and school personnel. Empowerment programmes in community settings to develop key transferable skills such as leadership and volunteerism were also implemented. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022
